Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Wayne Chen "the computer guy"
Reviews.Content: When I first heard about this camera, I was so excited I pre-ordered through Amazon. I'm so disappointed that I'm taking the time to write my first review ever.This is a beautiful camera. I took it to my company party and everyone asked me about it. People love the fact that you can scroll through pictures "IPhone style". But the pictures from the party came out terrible. It was grainy and sometimes blurry. I dismissed it because I was still sooo hot for this camera.When I start taking pictures and videos of my kids at home, the true color came out. Under bright indoor condition, the color looked awful. The video switches color while the video is being taken! Picture looked reddish at times. I started playing in the manual mode and it did look a little better. But still not nearly as good as my 4+ year old 5M camera. Outdoor shots the pictures looked ok.My mother in law was also in the market for a new camera so I lend her the S60. She's not very tech savvy so it's a real world test. She immediately had problems with the viewing and the "flipping" of the pictures. She also had problem zooming pictures in and out. Needless to say she didn't like it. I bought her a T700 from Sony and she loves it.I already got the return # from Amazon and it'll be my first return ever from an online purchase. I hope you find my review helpful. I used to work in a photo lab and I owned 2 digital cameras before. Both, sadly to say, were better than the S60.

Reviews.Title: Imature technology, unresponsive touch screen, battery-hog, and poor playback quality
Reviews.Author: G. LO
Reviews.Content: The idea of this product was very good.  That's why I couldn't wait to get one for my wife.  Unfortunately, the technology is just not mature at all.First, the touch screen responsiveness is wildly inconsistent.  Usually, it responds immediately.  However, sometimes, it takes 3 to 5 sec.  You would think that you didn't touch correctly and you would try to touch again, and again.  Then you would have touched the same thing twice or 3 times.  And you would have to undo the 2nd or 3rd touches.Second, the battery won't last 100 shots. If you use flash or touch the screen a lot, it probably is good for 60 or 70 shots.  You would need 2 or 3 batteries for your trips if you plan to take a lot of shots.Picture quality is so-so.  For a 10 mega-pixel camera, I expect a lot more than my old Canon 4 mega-pixel P&S.;  Even though my old pictures were taken in low resolution mode (300k to 500k in size each only) and the pictures from this camera were taken at the highest quality mode (4+ M in size each), I hardly notice any difference.  Needless to say, there is not even any comparison with my Olympus e-520 DSLR.For a while, I thought video taking would be ok.  It responded pretty fast.  Sound wasn't too bad either.  However, when I downloaded and watch the video on my computer, it was truly disappointing.Worst of all, on the live view, your pictures would look even worse.  So bad that I didn't even know if any of the pictures I took would be decent.  I guess the good thing was they all looked a bit better on the computer than on the live view playback mode since the live view screen was just plain terrible.I should have given it a 1 star, but I gave it 2 just because of the innovative idea.  But the quality of this product is just plain terrible.  And it is the first Vietnam-made electronic product that I have ever seen.  I think that may explain the poor quality.

Reviews.Title: Nikon S60 Does Well
Reviews.Author: Auburn Fan
Reviews.Content: I have had much better experience with my Nikon S60 than the other reviewers. We were headed on a vaction to Big Sur, and the cameras came out 2 weeks before we left. First one I received from Amazon had a cold solder joint internal to the camera, and would quit working when exposed to a 5 to 10 degree temp change. Amazon quickly replaced it (Thanks Amazon) and we were off to the coast. Took about 200 pics and videos during the trip, with most being big scenery. I agree with the other reviewers about the screen delay....but that is why it got a 4 instead of a 5. Picture quality was good, and the screen was easy to read, with no deciphering functions of tiny buttons grouped together like other P&S; I tried. Once using the camera, it was easy to switch between still and video, though it took about 3 screen taps. Zoom was impressive, including the digital zoom. Using the digital zoom, you have to be stabilized on something...tripod, fence, etc or the pics come out blurry. I took some great face shots of harbor seals that were about 25 feet away, but I had the camera on the pier handrail for stability. Video was good, but the microphone is very susceptible to wind noise. I am going to check into making a foam cover for it. Camera ON time is very quick...3 seconds so you don't miss the shot waiting for the camera to wake up. One "feature" I was confused about...I accidentally shot video instead of still, with the camera in the vertical position. So to watch the video, I have to look sideways. Nikon does not supply software to right these images. Windows Moviemaker will do it though. Transfer of the pics to computer works great...but don't do it without using their software if you want to play the images back using the HDMI feature. Camera keeps files of pic info, and if you make any changes to any of the pics, the info files don't match the pics and the camera does not recognize the pics anymore. You can still download via the memory card, you just can't use those cool playback features any more. I imagine that is a software upgrade that Nikon will correct. Overall I am happy with the camera, and look forward to many years' use.

Reviews.Title: Nikon should be ashamed!
Reviews.Author: C. Russell
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I've heard nothing but good things about Nikon and I was ready for a new P&S;, as mine is five years old. The Nikon DSLR's may be a favorite of photographers, but their P&S;'s - if this camera is any indication - is severely lacking!I have five-year-old 3MP Fugifilm camera that takes much, much, much better photos than this camera. The additional features, such as "retouch" to draw on the screen and add frames is a complete joke. The drawing feature is kind of cute if you like the five colors you have to choose from. The frames are graphics from 1996 era of websites, and on top of that, you only have five to choose from again. The polaroid one is kind of cute. You can also add "stamps" of hearts, flowers, stars, etc. They, too, are straight from 'My First Website' circa '96. Juvenile at best.The screen is unresponsive at times. The idea of having a touch screen was wildly appealing to me, but perhaps it's just not a good idea for a camera. I would have to see it to believe it would ever be more than novelty. The screen is also terribly grainy and, once again, worse than my tiny screen on my five-year-old camera.The pictures it took, regardless of scene mode, were ridiculously bad. Grainy, off-color, blurry - just terrible!! I have been wanting a new camera for quite a while, but this camera has made me appreciate how awesome my camera actually is. I did side-by-side comparisons and I feel like it's a waste of time to even type about how absurd the differences were. Like I said, Nikon should be ashamed.It was slow taking pictures, but fast loading.This color is pretty. That is honestly the only good thing I can say about this camera.

Reviews.Title: Not on par with competition
Reviews.Author: Joseph H. Wolenski
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst digital camera I've bought.The touch screen is difficult to use and I agree with other users that it tends to be unresponsive.The camera will take about 10 pictures before running out of memory.  An extra memory card is necessary.The images on the touch-screen display are grainy and of overall poor quality.The actual images themselves (after download to computer) are below average.  The pictures are washed out, of poor color, and many times slightly out of focus.  Wasn't this supposed to be a point and click camera?  Terrible.I'm surprised at Nikon.  With so many competitive cameras out there, you would think they would have delivered a top-notch product before the holiday buying season.  However, after one night's use with this camera I returned it.  Not worth the money.  Looks cool, though.

Reviews.Title: Steer Clear!
Reviews.Author: Jeff Gilbert
Reviews.Content: Generally, I love Nikon products.  I have a Nikon D40 DSLR and it is the best camera I have ever owned.  This camera does a disservice to the quality Nikon (and Nikkor) brand.First of all, the touchscreen is a joke.  It is very inconsistent, and having to use the screen to zoom is a pain in the butt.  It is difficult to delete images (need to go into playback mode, zoom in on them, and then click the trash can).  It is impossible to delete movies from the device, as the software is very buggy.  The graphics look like they came straight out of the 1980s - all white blocky text, and very limited pictograms for the icons.  The terrible UI basically negates any redeeming features this camera might have (VR, HDMI to name a few)As far as picture quality, this thing takes worse pictures than my Motorola RAZR!!  And the RAZR is only 1.2MP!  It takes MUCH worse pictures than an iphone.  Nikon seriously dropped the ball on this one.  EVERY picture I took came out incredibly grainy, and I dont know if its due to the sensor, or the ISO speed, because there is no way to select which ISO you would like to use.  Seriously, pictures from this camera are worthless.  I bought it yesterday with next day shipping so I could have it for the weekend.  After using it for like 10 minutes I decided I am going to return this incredibly sub-par product.  I went to Best Buy and bought a Canon Powershot SD1100 IS and it is far and above this abomination.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Point and Shoot Camera, users MUST USE common sense though...
Reviews.Author: Xbox Legend "Hybrid24"
Reviews.Content: So with all of the negative reviews I read I decided to take a chance because we were in need of a new point and shoot since our Kodak was pretty much useless and ate batteries like a guest during Thanksgiving dinner.  OMG, some of you casual users out there are dead wrong about this camera!  This camera is perfect for anyone looking for a simple, easy to use point and shoot with a large display screen that is compact enough to be "Johnny on the spot" when it comes to taking pictures.  There is a VERY SMALL learning curve when it comes to getting used to the interface as almost everything is done through the touch screen interface, which pretty much sums up one of the key features of this camera which some have complained about... this is a touch screen camera.  iPhone users like myself will find it to be a smooth transition, some might find different if anything, but different in a good way once you get used to it.Picture quality is where many of you are destroying this camera and kicking it to the curb.  Wait just one second there before you turn your back on this little gem.  The quality of these pictures, WHEN THE PICTURES ARE TAKEN USING COMMON SENSE, is on par with my SLR camera.  Let me explain in very simple terms for you haters out there, in low light situations, AS WITH ANY CAMERA, you have to consider many variables including whether or not you want to use a flash AND whether or not the subject is moving.  If you are not using a flash and your trying to get that last picture of drunken Timmy as he stumbles around trying to keep his balance and there is absolutely no light... by all means if you are upset about the picture you capture you should probably blame the genius photographer instead of the camera itself.  I'm sure these are the same people that blame the tree for moving out in front of their car.Anyways, the camera takes excellent pictures if you use common sense.  If you take the time to learn the features and scene modes of the camera, you will be just fine.  If a picture or two doesn't appear exactly as you want it, delete it and try again!  Imagine that, we're not working with film here...The video mode of this camera is the only feature that leaves room for improvement, but it still gets the job done.  But guess what shoppers... if you want a digital video recorder you probably shouldn't be purchasing a camera!  Overall, this camera gets 5 stars.  Nikon managed to integrate fantastic picture quality that they are known for into touch screen technology all found in a compact device.  For all the haters, go pick up a Fuji or Kodak that will do all of the "flawless" thinking for you.  Those should be simple enough for you to figure out and it'd be cool to have a camera with an equal intelligence level I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: Innovative, but not first-rate
Reviews.Author: Theatre Geek
Reviews.Content: I like the sleekness and the design, as well as the large LCD. It has been a hit with friends because of the innovative touch screen technology. But I have to agree with the others about the sensitivity of the touch screen. It lacks consistency.The pictures I took of landscapes are not bad. The colors and details are sharp. I'm not so crazy about portraits and anything taken indoor. Comes off grainy. Quality and the sound of videos are not remarkable. It's just like any other digital cameras.I would love to have a tangible zoom button.So if you're going for dazzle and functionality, you might as well get the Sony DSC-T77 or T700.

Reviews.Title: All That Glitters or How I Got Punk'd!
Reviews.Author: The Bij
Reviews.Content: The S60 is a piece of expensive crap.  "Useless" is an understatement.  I should have known better than to buy any camera which doesn't have TTL.  This is a pure LCD camera, and when it's sunny out, you don't see diddly. So how about indoors? Nada! Forget it! Picture quality is horrendous regardless of the environment it's taken in, which is mostly grainy and dark. Adjusting the exposure does not help.  Connecting to my iMac is also a problem.  It doesn't come up as a HDD, if anything at all, and thus you must install some pretty worthless software.  I can't begin to explain how furious I am for falling for the eye candy rather than the function.  No wonder I hate Ashton Kutcher...I got PUNK'D!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Peter Cattanio "catt man"
Reviews.Content: I researched this camera extensively,read many reviews and to be honest with you thought I made a mistake in buying this product. Don't listen to the negitive its all bull this camera is a great product,touch screen works very well,I can see where people wrote that the display is grainy, but they hesitate to tell you in very low light,other than that its good.Picture quality I think is excellent. The reviews went 50/50 but I would say dismiss the negative 50%.

Reviews.Title: cool camera
Reviews.Author: Major W. Wheelock III "Major"
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this camera on amazon.It is a great camera.  I was concerned about all the negative reveiws but I had to try it out. It is as good as any other P&S; camera out there. The touch screen is very cool if you are into it. if not buy one of the nikons without a touch screen. It takes excellent pictures for a P&S.; I think some reveiwers just didn't read the manual on how to use the settings or had expectations of an slr. this is a cool little camera, that fits in your pocket. Buy it.....Major Wheelock, New Hampshire

Reviews.Title: Looks good and that's all!!
Reviews.Author: A. Williams
Reviews.Content: One of the worst cameras I've ever had.The pictures are terrible. I upgraded from a cannon with 6 mps and 3 speed optical zoom which is 100 times better. Very very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: lovin it!
Reviews.Author: kristina fulton
Reviews.Content: I have loved loved loved my new camera.  The quality of the pictures is awesome for a small digital camera.  I love the fact that when you move the camera from side to side the picture changes positions like an iPod.  The settings work fantastic as well and I love the touch screen.  It also takes pictures close up very well.  The resolution is good where as with other cameras I've had a problem of close ups.  I recommend this camera for everyone-maybe not if you have really big or clumsy fingers because you might not like the touch screen since the icons are kind of small.

Reviews.Title: very disappointing
Reviews.Author: Jessie B. Natividad "JESSIE"
Reviews.Content: I am really really disappointed about this product NIKON S60. This is my very first Nikon product.At first , i was so excited to get it. Then, when i get the camera and try to test it, i was really mad because the screen was really blurry and when i took a picture, it wasn't really that great compare to Sony product so what i did, i return the item and went back to Sony again. I think i just learn my lesson.I should have listen to the comments that they make....

Reviews.Title: The S60 is awesome!
Reviews.Author: Andrea N.
Reviews.Content: Why all the negative reviews?  The S60 surpassed all my expectations...  The camera is gorgeous and quite an eye-catcher!  The touch screen is responsive and I find that using the stylus helps against fingerprints.  The screen is nice and big but, like some other reviews, is just a bit grainy.  Rest assured, however, that the actual quality of the image is far superior than what you see on the screen.  Images are crystal clear and true to color!  The S60 is very user-friendly, but make sure to read through the manual for proper settings to ensure perfection; it is definitely not as long and tedious as other reviewers make it seem.  I love this camera and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Camera
Reviews.Author: Peggy Mellies
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Italy and took over 900 pictures with this camera.  I almost didn't buy it due to some bad reviews.  I LOVE it.  I used four batteries to take 900+ pictures at the 5m setting.  Some pictures were taken in great outdoor light - wonderful pictures. Then some inside with low light - (churches)with beautiful results. Video worked great.  It is so easy to use and you can see easily if you got a great shot due to the large screen.  I highly recommend this camera and if you are going on a long trip just buy some extra batteries - they are not that expensive.  I bought five and only used four for a ten day period.The sports setting is nice to take rapid motion photos.  My dogs are in flyball and I got some great shots.I highly recommend this camera for ease of use and wonderful photos.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: D. Burdick "Dee"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera about a month now and really like it.  The picture quality is great, it's easy to use and fun as well.  I especially like the 'scene' option and use the sports selection when I want to get an action shot, finally I can take pictures of my dogs doing more than sleeping!  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the touch option to move between pictures is a bit slow, not a real problem because clicking on the arrow works just fine.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolipix S60 Review
Reviews.Author: Billy B "High Tech Whiz"
Reviews.Content: After reading the Users Manual, I found this camera to be very versatile and easy to use.  All of the photos came out great.  I am very pleased with it, and it's so small, too!

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed.
Reviews.Author: James Meaders
Reviews.Content: Lag time from when the shutter is tripped until the picture is taken is poor. To many shots lost. the screen sometimes locks  up. Love the big screen and easy controls. The rechargeable battery has worked out well.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Content: camera works great and takes great pictures. i dont like having to take the battery out to charge it and i wish the lens was in the center.seems my finger gets in the way.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Content: camera works great and takes great pictures. i dont like having to take the battery out to charge it and i wish the lens was in the center.seems my finger gets in the way.

Reviews.Title: Bad experience
Reviews.Author: W. A. Doyle "W.Doyle"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this Nikon S60. It was clearly said on the item description that the item is brand new. I received the product and is damaged. The picture was blur, eventhough I set it as automatic. I know what the picture resolution should be, specially for 10 MP! It made horrible pictures, even a disposable camera would make better pictures! I was so disapointed by this, I really like the camera feature, I love the touch screen, it's my dream pocket camera. So I had to return it, and thank's God, they gave me a refund, but then I have to search for the camera again that fit me and not broken one.I was so dissapointed that a big company like Amazon could make a big mistake like this. I will not buy anything anymore from this company.Nikon Coolpix S60 10MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom (Crimson Red)

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: Turkmeister10
Reviews.Content: I have owned my S60 for over 2 years now. I have seen all the negative reviews about the picture quality on many websites and I have to say that I experienced these problems as well in the beginning. However, I gave the camera a chance and it's been the best camera I have ever owned. Not only does it have great features, it takes great photos as well. You do have to play with the settings a bit (not too much, just the ISO, turn on distortion setting and improve megapixel level to your desire of photo quality) and it will be amazing. The only problem is that it looks fuzzy on the screen itself but the final product looks perfect on the computer and printed. definitely give it a try, really fun camera to use. it also takes shots fast. the touch screen i would say is pretty good. the only annoying thing is when u try to scroll through pictures you have taken, it sometimes zooms in on a picture instead. i just bought the S70 as a gift and i have seen many similar negative reviews to the ones S60 has had. however, many have suggested the same solution that the S60 requires. so i will definitely stick to my choice once again. i would say do not hesitate in buying either product.

Reviews.Title: Not To Shabby
Reviews.Author: Andrea Selvia
Reviews.Content: Just came in the mail today, Opened it up and started clicking away! Its a little tricky at first with the different "Scene settings".  if you take a picture up close, without the "Portrait" setting on it can become blurry and look like absolute crap! Easily can be fixed though when you place it to "Auto Scene Setting" which  detects  the atmosphere and automatically adjusts  to the picture....Which doesnt always work so great. Cool diffrent features in scene mode , such as fireworks, food and party/indoor. Tested it out on the food, but i had to adjust the settings to the flash  to  get the picture i really wanted.Its alot of adjusting you have to do before you can take a picture.So if your the type of perosn who just turns it on and  clicks away , this probably isint the  camera for you. On the contrary, If your a lil Tech savvy and want each picture to demonstrate its best attributes and quality, then this is just what you want. Browsing the menu  is very easy  and  explains almost every feature designated by the "?" symbol,  so not much reading of the manuel  to get the point of the features.  So far the pictures I have taken, are absolutely beautiful and when zoomed in, are CRYSTAL CLEAR.The holidays are coming up  so ill be taking plenty pictures and  post my reveiw on the diffrent scene settings!

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Nakia Feribee "Nikkmatic"
Reviews.Content: This camera is lovely, the pictures are blurry because you have to give the screen a chance to adjust, read the manual and test the camera out you will be suprised how good the camera actually is. Most bad reviews are from people who dont take there time. This is the best camera out. I LOVE IT........

Reviews.Title: Horrible camera - canon powershot is much better
Reviews.Author: K. Hughes
Reviews.Content: I hate to say negative things about a product, especially one that promises to be as cool as this one did, but the quality of pictures this camera takes is really poor.They are blurry, they are poorly exposed, the flash does not work properly - they are something you would expect from a $75 digital camera - not a $200 camera.I got it as a gift because our Canon Powershot got ruined when my husband accidentally took it into the ocean. I have a Nikon film-based SLR that I love, but when it comes to digital point-and-shoots, stick with Canon. That powershot took the best pictures - clear, well-focused, well-exposed. It may not look as cool as the coolpix, especially with the touch screen (which doesn't work that well either, by the way) but the pictures are much better. And that's what really matters, right?I'm writing Nikon I'm so disappointed and I'm trying to exchange it for a Canon. Don't do it - you'll be sorry.

Reviews.Title: Great product, lots of fun and easy
Reviews.Author: Irina Boudreau
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning all the features, but so far I've been very pleased with this camera. Picture quality is great. All pictures come out good on auto adjust settings. The camera has many others, for night time, indoor, outdoor, party, etc, but the auto seems to work the best. But like I said I'm still learning how to use the camera. The only thing that I dont care for is the screen being too sensitive. When flipping through pictures with your finger, a lot of times it would zoom in on the picture instead of going to the next one. Also in preview mode, the pictures look grainy, not very clear. And of course the "finger" features are not so easy to use as Ashton does it in the ad. :) But overall, I love the camera and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: A gift for my 24 yr old sister - She loves this camera!
Reviews.Author: Karen A.
Reviews.Content: For the most part, this camera is good.  It's easy to use, it gets a little stuck when trying to move to view the next picture but all in all it is a good camera.  Takes really good pictures.  I prefer a Canon but not bad for young people.

Reviews.Title: not a techy
Reviews.Author: Fifi
Reviews.Content: This camera was a gift so I really didn't do any research on it before I received it. I am not very good at reading directions until AFTER I've attempted to figure things out on my own, so having said that, this is a pretty cool camera. Of course, the looks are awesome, and the functionality is great, if you don't do things backwards like me! It does have a problem with the scrolling going too fast and seemingly out of control like it has a mind of it's own sometimes, but if you just stop and let it settle, it only takes a second. I would have liked to have a longer battery life or have the option of using AA's in a pinch.I like the quality of the pictures, once you know how to use it. Still finding features I didn't know it had. A year ago, I received it about a week before a trip to Isreal and those pix are awesome!The picture automatically turning when you turn the camera is a cool option, but I would like to lock it sometimes and I haven't figured that out or even if it's possible.

Reviews.Title: Happy with S60
Reviews.Author: Larry Gerhardstein
Reviews.Content: Bought an S60 last November for Italy trip.  I loved it... small, light weight, compact, and easy to use.  I can count the times I used the manual on about 2 fingers.  Took hundreds of pics in Italy.  Now the camera is missing.  Went to Hawaii with it, and somewhere on the way back, I misplaced it.  Let me know if you find it.  The boot up photo is of our cat Felix.  If I do not find it, I'll buy another.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jady bug
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera not too long ago but so far I LOVE it! It takes a little while to learn all of the features because there are so many different things it can do! It comes with a great manual that explains things very well. I love the touch screen and I love that it takes 30 minute videos WITH sound! Well worth the money spent!

Reviews.Title: Sorely disappointed
Reviews.Author: K. Thompson
Reviews.Content: Was so looking forward this this "great camera." Outdoors-it is a gem; Wonderful, vibrant colors abound! Indoors-the pictures are very grainy and have a yellowish tint. For what you are paying-there is NO way you should have to settle for mediocrity. The novelty of the touch screen is great-but that doesn't cut it for me.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: luanne kelly "LKelly"
Reviews.Content: This is the coolest camera ever. Recommend it highly, easy to use, it features are the best, it's almost like a mini Mac the things you can do the pictures after you take them.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT!
Reviews.Author: Ashley Foster
Reviews.Content: This Camera is amazing for me! It's sleek and fits in my pocket perfectly. If only it came in green. Besides that, it's easy for me to use, I think it only took me two days to figure it out. Only one day to read it the other day to go step by step form the book. Now I can make and post my videos on youtube. I can use all kinds of different settings to make maximize the quality of the pictures I take. I love it! It's really easy to use, I recommend it to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: Cool Pix
Reviews.Author: Amy Bates "gypsymom2"
Reviews.Content: So far I have been happy with the camera. The size is good and fits well in any of my purses. My only complaint is that the picture quality isn't what I was hoping for. I will still work on correcting this issue.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Green "KengShopping"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my girlfriend and so far it is a perfect fit.  The reason I did not rate it higher is because I did not spend more time with it or looking at the pictures/video's it takes.  I can only tell you that it is very friendly and easy to use.  The touch screen menu on the back was a bonus because I didn't even know it came that way.  Guess I should of looked closer at the specs.  I would recommend getting a car charger for about $15 and 2 back up batteries for about $7 a piece.  Oh, and a tightly fitting neoprene case.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: A. Delmege
Reviews.Content: the nikon cooplix is an amazing camera. i have not had any problems with the touch screen feature. my pictures are clear and crisp. love it and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix s60
Reviews.Author: L. Dashiell
Reviews.Content: Works well.  Adorama shipped it quickly.  It was a gift for my brother and he loves it.  Relates that the camera is easy to use and very effecient.  Does run out of battery quickly, but there is the option to buy an extra.  I recommend buying a fairly expensive memory card to hold extra pictures at a high quality.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Alan Olson
Reviews.Content: the nikon coolpix s60 is a great camera with multiple features that most cameras dont have. Touch screen that you can write on.

Reviews.Title: Love It.
Reviews.Author: R. Hermann "Toy Lover"
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this for me for christmas and I love it.  It's great for what I need it for, taking pictures of my kids and the kids get a kick out of watching me put little frames around their pictures.

Reviews.Title: First Time User
Reviews.Author: Cody Kodak
Reviews.Content: As a first time user of a digital camera, I am having fun learning how to use it.  So far I especially likedbeing able to write on a photo with the stylus. Before buying it I would have wanted to know howmany photos are stored on a typical memory card. Gradually I am more willing to experiment withthe camera and overcome my camera phobia.

Reviews.Title: So Hot it Fizzles Out
Reviews.Author: KB
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get this camera. . . turns out, it's all hype. The touch screen works well some of the time, but all too often you have to sit there and poke it. There were quite a few occasions in which it froze and nothing short of removing the battery would remedy it. The display isn't impressive on the camera, and to be honest it's not much better once you put it on your computer. Especially considering the price, I would recommend getting something else. It's a gorgeous camera but doesn't perform well at all.

Reviews.Title: Great stylish camera for your night outs!!!
Reviews.Author: A. Fang "Truth Seeker"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for almost a month and i absolutely love it! A lot of people are complimenting on the camera especailly saying how cool and stylish it looks. It also takes great pictures. I'm not sure what other reviewers are reviewing but this is a decent camera with a good VR and Zoom.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix S60
Reviews.Author: THIEN TRUONG
Reviews.Content: The idea of this product was very good. That's why I couldn't wait to get one for my wife. Unfortunately, the technology is just not mature at all.First, the touch screen responsiveness is wildly inconsistent. Usually, it responds immediately. However, sometimes, it takes 3 to 5 sec. You would think that you didn't touch correctly and you would try to touch again, and again. Then you would have touched the same thing twice or 3 times. And you would have to undo the 2nd or 3rd touches.Second, the battery won't last 100 shots. If you use flash or touch the screen a lot, it probably is good for 60 or 70 shots. You would need 2 or 3 batteries for your trips if you plan to take a lot of shots.

Reviews.Title: Love Nikon
Reviews.Author: Carla Sabatino
Reviews.Content: All Nikon's are great but for the price of this one-it takes just as good pics as my DSLR.  I'm very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Sean Kyser
Reviews.Content: Was a gift for my oldest daughter and she carries it everywhere to take, edit, and publish great pictures! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: William Rasbeary
Reviews.Content: Takes awesome pictures and pretty good video. Had one before and I broke it, so I knew I wanted another one since I was familiar with how to operate it. Good camera and a total all around good experience with my quest to replace my other one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: Daniel Shorr
Reviews.Content: An excellent camera. It has it's own quirks that need getting used to (what product doesn't?), but overall I am very pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Nice to have but..
Reviews.Author: Just213
Reviews.Content: I had a coolpix before & the quality was nice.  My phone takes great pics & I can upload & back up with ease.  This isnt as great as I thought it was.  I was fine without this camera & I havent used it in months.  So the product isnt bad per se, but I have a more efficent way of taking pictures and this is an obsolete device in my home.

Reviews.Title: Good Pictures---Not very Durable
Reviews.Author: Jim Tigger "tigger"
Reviews.Content: The camera takes excellent pictures, but failed after a month.  There is a shutter that closes in-front of the lens and it hung up open rendering the camera useless.  I've sent it back to the factory for repairs hopefully under warranty.  I am gentle with equipment and can only conclude that the camera is not very durable.The lens is in the place where one would expect an optical viewfinder and not in the center.  I have a lot of pictures of the edge of my finger framing the picture.I would not buy this camera again given its fragility.  I purchased it from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: s60 nikon
Reviews.Author: Thomas Archuleta
Reviews.Content: sorry for the people who have problems with this camara. my self have no problems its a great camara, great pics great vid. my sister wanted one so i bought her one. bought one for my mother she loves it . once agian its a great camara .

Reviews.Title: Not the greatest
Reviews.Author: HMCharmed
Reviews.Content: When we first bought it, there was something wrong with the pixels. So we returned it for a new one. This new one worked great for awhile before we'd get a lens error, which was a pain. Therefore, I would not recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Worst point and shoot Ive ever owned
Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: We got this camera to replace the Cannon PNS that my husband dropped in the lake (and oh how I loved that camera!). He was swooned in to buying it because of the "cool touch screen". Needless to say it didnt live up to it's hype in my book. It almost made me want to never own a Nikon when it came time to buy a DSLR.Anyhow, what I hated:1: The touch screen is a joke. It's slow, hard to see and difficult to use. It often trips up and instead of gliding over to the next picture it jams up and glides through 8 at one time not letting you see the picture you intended.2: It takes the WORST pictures Ive seen in a digital camera in YEARS. They are pixilated, the flash sucks so the lighting is always horrible and Ive never been able to take a picture I loved on it. My smart phone takes better pictures.What I liked:1: The color. That is about it.

Reviews.Title: Satisfactory
Reviews.Author: Praise
Reviews.Content: The product is ok but you could get a better camera. It's 10 or 12 megapixels but it doesn't really show. Other than that i've been reading that the touch screen is slow to respond but it's not for me it works perfectly fine.

Reviews.Title: Coldpix S60
Reviews.Author: Darrell W Rumsey
Reviews.Content: I have had several Coolpix cameras and the only one which meets MY needs perfectly as the S60.  The ability to write on the pictures as well as crop them easily is most appreciated. Unfortunately, someone else values the S60 as much as I do, as both cameras I ordered 6 weeks ago have been stolen from a beach in Mexico.  I have to say that I am either careless or neglectful when it comes to cameras as these two were my seventh and eighth because of earlier loss or their being stolen.  I am having difficulty replacing the S60 but I will keep trying as long as this model is available and should I continue my regrettable pattern of losses.  Darrell W Rumsey

Reviews.Title: poor customer service
Reviews.Author: luv 2 shop
Reviews.Content: The customer service I received from Nikon for this camera has forced me to write my first product review also.  After reading many reviews, I bought 2 nikon coolpix cameras within a few months - one for me and one for my daughter.  Within 2 months her camera lens would not fully open and read lens error.  Since hers was the second camera purchased and still within the warranty - after many emails and phone calls with "less than helpful" people they finally fixed it with out charge. A few months later, my camera had the same issue - of course while I was on my vacation in Hawaii that I had saved many years for.  Nikon was again less than helpful and only offered to repair the camera for $80 - I had only paid $140!  The customer service people act as if you are doing them a favor.  They have no interest in helping whatsoever. Even in this economy they act as if they have no worry over their job or their company.  I have never encountered such pathetic ill-mannered people.  I am now looking for an SLR but  will never buy another Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera ever!
Reviews.Author: Brad Lowe "Krys"
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about this camera!  I guess I got suckered by the cool ad campaign that made the features look so cool and this pics look great.The photos I take are about 80% grainy or blurry with color distortion. In sunlight everything is washed out, in low light all is orange, forget about trying to take an action shot!  I'm a fairly experienced photographer and just wanted an easy point and shoot for the family to use.  I've played with settings, reset to factory setting, nothing helps.  DO NOT BUY THIS!  I can't beleiive Nikon produced such a colossal piece of crap camera.  My camera on my phone take superior pics to this.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: airsoftdude
Reviews.Content: It came quickly its a decent camerea and is very cool. Grat customer service. This the first time buying from amazon and i will do it again.

Reviews.Title: Third Warranty Repair-Still a paperweight
Reviews.Author: Cashmir "Kash-Cash"
Reviews.Content: Purchased camera in Jan 2009. Stops working less than a month later. Nikon repairs camera but sends back a totally different camera that looked like it had be thrown from a moving car. They actually mailed my camera to someone else. It took several months and many follow up calls to get them to send back at least a refurb. That replacement also stopped working a couple of months later. Sent it back for warranty repair. This time it was repaired and returned to me. Still the darn camera doesn't work. The shutter stays shut. It's a terrible camera. I also purchased a less expensive Canon, without a touch screen. The Canon never fails. It's battery life is great.  I've abused the Canon and it works every time.Hate is a strong word but, I have hate for Nikons terrible Customer Service and their horrible products.

Reviews.Title: really?
Reviews.Author: Mar "Marinera"
Reviews.Content: i wanted a large 3.5 inch camera, i got this one but i have to put it back in box after a day and return.what a crapy camera ! pics are blurry with bad colors.i change setting and try different modes and still bad.also slow as can be.i really wanted a 3.5 inch camera wich one you recomend me? sorry my english.

Reviews.Title: ok for a short-time use
Reviews.Author: N. Salazar "NV"
Reviews.Content: Since this is my ONLY camera, this goes haywire after 8 months. It shuts down every time after you take a shot, the video plays when your trying to flip the through the thumbnails, 50/50 on the quality of the pics and videos, and now I'm waiting for what else this camera has for more headaches. So I recommend this camera ONLY if you'll be getting a better camera really soon or have this camera as a back-up.These cameras should be the next disposable cameras sold in souvenir shops because these would sell great!

Reviews.Title: nikon cooolpix s60
Reviews.Author: david s niakamal "DS Nia."
Reviews.Content: This was a used camera and I received it in the mail. The battery would not charge up. I used another nikon charger to see if it was the battery or the charger. It was the charger. I sent the charger back and another was sent to me in the mail. Its not from the original manufaturer (Nikon). The camera has turned out to be ok, but the moral of the story is to pay a the extra $ and get it new, at least when it comes to cameras.

Reviews.Title: Worst Pictures Ever!!!
Reviews.Author: directs1 "directs1"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for the holidays and sad to say I had better pictures with my cell phone... I returned it back to the store. The camera has a nice campaign with Ashton...the camera also looks neat with being all touch screen but at the end the camera doesn't do what it suppose to do... take good pictures!!!

Reviews.Title: Typical Nikon Point and Shoot flaws
Reviews.Author: B. H. Ogle "hidden light photography"
Reviews.Content: In the U.S., Nikon is certainly marketing its point and shoot cameras better than Canon or Sony. The Nikon team uses a simple formula to win market share: Pay young, good looking actors and actresses to promote flashy, novel products. This was the case with the Coolpix S60 - a touch screen, in camera editing, a high megapixel count, Ashton....But the "good stuff ends there." I purchased the camera for a friend one year ago against my better judgement. I could tell in the store that the picture quality was very poor. It is among the worst I have even seen. The White Balance is always off; especially indoors. The contrast is poor; even in the best lighting situations images look far to gray. The color reproduction is ok for dark blues, purples and magentas, but poor for blacks, whites, and yellows. Sharpness is ok - consistent with what you would see on most other point and shoots.As with all Nikon cameras (even DSLR's) digital noise (the grainy patches of hot white and errant red and blue pixels) is awful! If you are going to puchase a Nikon point and shoot, purchase noise reduction software too (Neat image is cheap, EASY to use, and can work as a standalone product).Besides picture quality, which is the most important aspect of the camera for me, the navigation is tricky. Switching camera settings (i.e. landscape to portrait) is time consuming. The touch screen navigation is inferior and glicthes often - the touch screen on my Verizon voyager is so much more accurate and responsive.I have to say something positive, otherwise it might appear that I have some strong bias against Nikon (which I do) or point and shoots in general (which isn't 100% true - they can be useful). The fact that the lense doesn't extend from the camera is awesome! You don't miss the extra optical zoom in most cases, and the chance of the lense snapping is gone.All in all, shop around before you make this purchase. Check out the other major camera vendors, or even another P&S; within the Nikon brand.-Hidden Light Photography BHO

Reviews.Title: Poor quality display and photos
Reviews.Author: FranklinTNShopper
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera and took with us to Disney. Pictures looked crummy on the screen, but we hoped it was just the screen. Once uploaded the pictures looked just as crummy. (Luckily, we also had our SLR on the trip) Obviously, nothing will look as good as an SLR, but the S60 was pretty bad.We returned it this morning for a Cybershot-TX1 that looks to be MUCH better all around.

Reviews.Title: Camera Savvy
Reviews.Author: Lawanda C. Morris
Reviews.Content: I was really excited about receiving this product after seeing Ashton K. handle it so easily. Every thing is great...except the touch screen can be difficult to work. It might not change screens, then it might just magnify the picture when you are trying to switch to another picture. Also had some trouble deleting pictures...the darn things just would go away! But I finally got them deleted. But overall I think its a good product. I am not accustom to using a high tech digital camera..so I will put some of the blame on myself. Happy Snapping!

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: M. Refael "The Buyer"
Reviews.Content: i think this camera is awesome its really cool it has a touch  screen so u can draw on your pictures it fits easily into my pocket dont listen to the other reviews this camera is good it takes pretty good pictures u can make frames and even make people fatter if u want u should get refurbished because its just as good as new but its  half the price its also a very hot looking camera and its touch screen is like a itouchs (ipod touch) screen (if u dont know what a itouchs screen is like its really good and get one to)i really recomend it

Reviews.Title: Pretty cool features, horrible pictures
Reviews.Author: Pablo Golcher "Electronaut"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and was pretty excited about it, I've never seen such a cool camera.  The touchscreen, the stamps, everything on it seem so awesome but when I got home and start testing it is when I saw it's true colors.This camera just can't get a good picture indoors in fact I can't get a good pic unless light conditions are perfect.  It was so frustraiting, all pics came out grainy so yeah many nice things on this camera but what's the use of it if it can do everything except take good pics?

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Susan M. Strickland "Sue from South Carolina"
Reviews.Content: A great camera.  Took clear, crisp pictures all the time.  Easy to use and carry.  I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Takes some getting used to, but good camera!
Reviews.Author: B. J. Witcraft "BJWitcraft"
Reviews.Content: I tend to wonder about the other reviewers who complain a lot about this camera.  With each new camera and change in technology, there are bound to be differences and things you will have to get used to.  First off, I took 400 photos at a concert on a single battery.  However, because the ISO can be set to 3200 (which most smaller cameras can not!) I did not need to use the flash at all!  I am sure, if you are not willing to increase the ISO, the flash will, as with all cameras, eat through the battery pretty quick.My only complaint so far, and I have had this camera for 3 months, is the location of the zoom.  I feel this was placed a bit low on the screen and takes some true getting used to.  The screen responce can get sluggish, but I have found this to me true when you have a large number of photos on the card.  When flipping through the 400 photos I took, it was pretty sluggish, but when I was flipping through 100 or so, it was just fine.I have also compared my photos with my D200 (I take outdoor photos) and I coudl not tell a difference...and neither could a prof. photographer who I sent my photos to for editing.All if all, this is a great camera! It takes some getting used to, but I have been very happy with my 3 mo. using it.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: M. schulz
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get this camera but after having it for a month I was VERY disappointed!! This is the first Nikon camera I have ever owned and I hate to say it, but it will be the last. This camera took very crappy pictures. I also have a 7 mp Cannon camera and that camera takes great pictures! I ended up selling this nikon on craigslist for half the price I paid for it. THIS CAMERA IS A WASTE OF MONEY!!!!

Reviews.Title: Run Fast From This Camera!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "MrsDunk"
Reviews.Content: Straight out of the box this camera will take grainy and blurry pictures.  I had this camera for 5 months and it never took a good picture.  I missed Christmas, birthdays, baseball, and vacation because every time I sent it in to get repaired by Nikon, I trusted them and thought it would take a good picture.  Absolute JUNK!  Topping it all off, Nikon has horrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: S60 Review
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Salony
Reviews.Content: Very dissappointed with this camera.  The touch screen freezes, the review of the pictures on the LCD screen is poor quality, review of pictures using fingers to slide them across sometimes works and sometimes doesn't. Alot of wite speck when taking indoor pictures. Video clips are very poor quality. I had an old Coolpix prior to this one, and would turn back to that one in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: ikon Coollpix 360
Reviews.Author: Stefanie
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 14 year old daughter for her birthday and we could not be happier. Camera is easy to use and pictures are great!

Reviews.Title: My Hands-on test proves it is too annoying for me
Reviews.Author: Jim Hammond
Reviews.Content: If you haven't been using one of these ultra-compact internal sliding prism digital cameras, then you are missing out. I have over 5000 pictures and 500 videos of experience with cameras like this. I started with the Sony DSC-T1, then the DSC-T9, and most recently the DSC-T300.They enable you to have a camera/camcorder on your person 24/7. They are not the best at either role, but I have found that one good camera/camcorder in your pocket is way more useful than carrying two bigger devices (a great camera and a great camcorder) - especially when you have left them in your in your car or at home.Perhaps most surprising is that even the video and sound quality on these little cameras was quite good all the way back to the DSC-T1, so I pretty much stopped using a camcorder at that point.I'm sure that others will post more thorough reviews soon, but I wanted to get this info out as soon as possible to help others. For example, it is already enough for me to make my purchase decision, and it answers a key question that I have not been able to find the answer to after weeks of research, which is "Can it zoom while recording video?"Based on reviews of previous models of this camera, I had high expectations. I expected high image quality and good low light performance. I was planning to buy it after I verified that it could zoom while recording video.After getting my hands on one and playing with it for about 10 minutes, I did verify that it can zoom while recording video, and although I have not yet been able to test its image quality, I will not be buying one of these.I frequenty switch between video and still photos, and I use zoom extensively. This kind of usage would be very annoying with this camera because both of these features are controlled through the touch screen, which is sluggish, unresponsive, klunky, etc., and thus I would miss many shots. I would not want to have to look forward to this kind of annoyance for the next two years.If the DSC-T500 has good enough image quality, I will buy that instead. It has mechanical controls for video/photo and zoom, and it has trail-blazing 720p HD video with stereo sound. It also records video in Mpeg4, which should be viewable on my iPod Touch. Its predecessor, the DSC-T300, felt like it was built with much higher quality than the S60, and it had very responsive zoom, unfortunately it had poor image quality.

Reviews.Title: Ex-Nikon Fan
Reviews.Author: K. Heer
Reviews.Content: I have always been a fan of Nikon and so when I received my new Coolpix S60 I had high expectations. What a disappointment. The touchscreen is so far behind the technology on my iPhone that it seems like a child's toy.The vibration reduction seems to be non-existent, photos have movement and are just not "crisp" at all.The shutter speed is really slow - you have to time things and "pre-shoot" in order to capture the image.After trying to see any positives in the camera for a week I returned it.Really, really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: The Bad Idea Interface
Reviews.Author: Barton Smith "smittybart"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in a rush on the advice of a local seller.  I told him that I had really liked my Canon SD770 and was looking for something like it.  He talked up the touch interface.  Once I got it home, I realized how much work Apple must have done on the iPhone, because this thing was impossible to use.  If you can't take the picture you want to when you want to, nothing else about the camera matters.  I suspect that much of the trouble could be fixed with a firmware upgrade (I had the original firmware), but even then, what is wrong with having real buttons for zoom?  I don't want to look at the screen to see where the zoom buttons are, and even if you find them, they are often unresponsive.  The large zoom seems to come at the expense of the f# (compared to the Canons) and the pictures were usually noisy.  The menus are not intuitive at all.  I have one good thing to say: the time-lapse movie option is cool.  At the end of the day, I returned it and bought an SD 880, and I am very happy.

Reviews.Title: Good Pics
Reviews.Author: F. Alba
Reviews.Content: I am happy with the research that I did for this camera.  It has all the functions that I need and has resolveda lot of issues associated with picture taking for me.  The camera has virtually eliminated blurred, red eyed,eyes closed, no exposure pictures.  The large screen on the back lends to the correct positioning of the subjectyou are shooting. The touch screen makes it easier to select how you want to shoot and review what you have shot.After going through several cameras that have fallen short of the features that this camera has, I think this isa keeper.  It is really easy for my wife to use also.  In fact, it is hard to get it away from her.

Reviews.Title: Great Product/Terrible Service
Reviews.Author: Disappointed
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix is a great product, but it will be a very long time before I order electronics via Amazon. And I will never order electronics with Amazon when there is any time sensitivity.The product itself is great. My son can't get enough of it. Takes it wherever he goes and my entire family loves the extraordinary clarity of the pictures. Every photos is crisp, clean, sharp. There really isn't anything to think about. If you want one, get one. If you order it here, buyer beware.My son saved his money and I ordered the Nikon Coolpix S60 from Amazon because it was a good price compared to in-store. He wanted it for all the graduation events coming up for him and thought to save a bit of money. He has regretted it ever since. So have I.When the expected delivery date came and went, he was disappointed. I explained that things happen. I understood, but he had to understand, too, that the expected delivery date was not a guaranteed delivery date. Ok, so he missed one event with his friends: there were many others.Ten days later, having now missed several events, I called Amazon customer service and was assured it would arrive the next day. It didn't. He (and I) missed another irreproducible graduation event. When it didn't arrive as promised, I called customer service a second time. This time I was promised it would arrive next day before noon. It didn't. In fairness, it came that day, but around 6pm.The camera is great. Get it--elsewhere. My complaint is with Amazon. The delivery system needs an overhaul. Customer service was horrendous. When the camera did finally arrive two weeks after the expected delivery date, there was no explanation, no "all out recovery." Sure, they paid over-night shipping, but it wasn't over-night: it was 14 days late! Caveat Emptor.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera! Wrong Color.
Reviews.Author: Thomas R. Anderson
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my wife. She loves this camera. I ordered the crimson red, but got the gold although the box shows it in red. She loves it in any color. I haven't seen her this excited over any gift in a very long time. I might buy one for me now.

Reviews.Title: nikon s60 write on screen
Reviews.Author: M. joanTretter "camper"
Reviews.Content: The write on screen is perfect for enhancing Native American rock art pictures on site. Often very faded rock art turns out to be a picture of a rock unless you are on site and can see the faint outlines which you can then mark on the picture. Bet they didn't think of this use!NOw how about a bigger lcd?

Reviews.Title: not happy
Reviews.Author: Milagros Gargurevich
Reviews.Content: Not happy at all with this product. for some reason the lcd display is blury and not clear at all.

Reviews.Title: Great camea
Reviews.Author: Z. Khan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my girl friend for Christmas and she loves it. Very faminine, user friendly and easy for women. :-) I would definitely recommend this product to other people.

Reviews.Title: I can tell you about a camera that IS good...
Reviews.Author: Lisa Lisa
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good new camera for my daughter and thought I'd read the reviews for this one...wow, I am so sorry to hear that people had a bad experience.So I thought that I would offer that I own a SONY CYBER-SHOT 10.1 megpxls Carl Zeiss), which I got over a year ago, has the touch screen and all...and it is the best camera I ever had.  Pictures great, easy to use, very compact, battery lasts long, I have nothing bad to say.  I wish the case offered has been bigger maybe.  BUT I was looking for a newer camera, and, this one is I think a year old, but you may wish to consider becasue it may be cheaper and it works great.  Just my 2 cents to help...

ProductInfo.Features:
10.0-megapixel resolution for stunning prints as large as 16 x 20 inches
5x optical Zoom-Nikkor glass lens; Optical VR Image Stabilization
3.5-inch high-resolution touch-panel LCD; customizable touch-panel display
Auto adjusts up to ISO 3200; Shutter and Blink Warning
Captures images to SD/SDHC cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon Coolpix S60 10MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom (Crimson Red)
